Dear NAEB Member:
Here’s another questionnaire I
You probably dislike filling out these things just
as much as I do. But, when Dick Hull asked me to gather
some budget data for the NAEB meeting next month, I was
glad to take on the project—despite my feeling that too
many people send out too many questionnaires gathering
too much data about too many unimportant subjects !
But this questionnaire has at least one distinctive
feature: it deals with a subject of interest and import¬
ance to every station manager—comparative budget data.
The attached questionnaire should be self-explanatory.
I’ve tried to include most of the positions to be found
at NAEB stations. Space has been left for you to add any
I may have missed. If your staff setup combines some of
these positions, please show that in your reply. In other
words, don’t hesitate to add, subtract, or alter this form
if thereby your answers are made more meaningful.
Needless to say all the data you send me will be
held in strict confidence. It will be processed for
distribution just to NAEB members. References to individ¬
ual stations will be by code letters only.
■Kill you help me by filling out this questionnaire,
and returning it to me as soon as possible?
See you at Ann Arbor!
Yours sincerely,
[fS U'vtOL
Burton Paulu
Manager of KUOM
